summary: FBI interview with Larry Visoski, chief pilot for Jeffrey Epstein, conducted on December 4, 2006. Visoski provides details about his employment, Epstein's travel patterns, properties, staff, and denies observing any inappropriate behavior or underage girls on Epstein's aircraft.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.role: Chief Captain Pilot for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI; provides information about Epstein's travel, aircraft, properties, and staff. Denies seeing any inappropriate behavior or underage girls on flights.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Wealthy individual under investigation; employs Visoski as pilot. Described as having wealth from managing money, back problems, and receiving massages.

persons.name: Dave Rodgers
persons.context: Former chief captain replaced by Visoski approximately two years prior to the interview. Provided 2004 flight manifests per grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Owner of Limited Corporation; described as Epstein's good friend and successful business relationship.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described by Visoski as Epstein's best friend and business manager. Occasionally calls Visoski to set up flight arrangements.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in context of a practical joke where Epstein asked Visoski to place condoms on Trump's aircraft seat after learning Trump's girlfriend was pregnant.

persons.name: Bruce White
persons.context: Epstein's boat captain in the U.S. Virgin Islands. Telephone number provided by Visoski.

persons.name: Bryce LNU
persons.context: Manages Epstein's ranch in New Mexico; arranges masseuses from 'Ten Thousand Waves' salon for Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Miles Alexander
persons.context: Listed by Visoski as a current employee managing Epstein's island in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Janus
persons.context: Listed by Visoski as house staff at Epstein's Palm Beach residence.

persons.name: John Michael
persons.context: Listed by Visoski as a prior chef for Epstein. Possibly same as 'Sally Egor Zinoview' listed adjacent.

persons.name: Sally Egor Zinoview
persons.context: Listed by Visoski as a Russian fitness instructor for Epstein.

persons.name: Lance Callaway
persons.context: Listed by Visoski as Epstein's current chef.

persons.name: Roberto LNU
persons.context: Listed by Visoski as a prior chef for Epstein.

persons.name: David Mullen
persons.context: Listed by Visoski as a prior chef for Epstein.

persons.name: Brent Tidwell
persons.context: Listed by Visoski as a prior chef for Epstein.

persons.name: Adam Perrylang
persons.context: Listed by Visoski as a prior chef for Epstein.

connections.description: Epstein employs Visoski as his chief pilot since 1990. Visoski reports on Epstein's travel, aircraft, and properties.
Described by Visoski as Epstein's best friend and business manager. She helps set up flight arrangements.
Described as Epstein's good friend and successful business relationship. Epstein's wealth reportedly comes from managing money, possibly linked to Wexner.
Epstein played a practical joke on Trump involving condoms on an aircraft seat, indicating a personal acquaintance.
Visoski replaced Rodgers as chief captain approximately two years prior because Epstein preferred Visoski's communication and flying skills.
White is Epstein's boat captain in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
Bryce is the ranch manager in New Mexico who arranges massages for Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: FBI Interview of Larry Visoski
events.description: FBI agents interview Epstein's chief pilot, Larry Visoski, at the Palm Beach County Resident Agency. He provides details about Epstein's operations, travel, staff, and denies seeing any misconduct.

events.title: Hurricane Wilma Damages Palm Beach Residence
events.description: Epstein had not been to his Palm Beach residence since sometime in 2005 due to damage caused by Hurricane Wilma.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena for Flight Manifests
events.description: Visoski states he provided the 2005 flight manifest and Dave Rogers provided the 2004 manifest in response to a grand jury subpoena.

locations: 505 South Flagler, West Palm Beach, Florida (FBI PBCRA office)
Palm Beach residence (damaged by Hurricane Wilma)
St. Thomas, U.S.V.I. (Marriot Frenchmans Reef, Holiday Inn Express where pilots stay)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Ten Thousand Waves salon)
Columbus, Ohio (location of Glimcher Real Estate Developer)
keyFacts: Larry Visoski, Epstein's chief pilot, explicitly stated he has never seen any women or girls under age 20 on Epstein's aircraft and never observed any inappropriate sexual behavior by Epstein.
Visoski described a practical joke where Epstein asked him to place a box of condoms on Donald Trump's aircraft seat after learning Trump's girlfriend was pregnant.
Flight manifests for 2004 and 2005 were provided to the FBI in response to a grand jury subpoena, indicating an active investigation into Epstein's travel.
Visoski listed numerous current and past employees of Epstein, including Ghislaine Maxwell (business manager/best friend), boat captain Bruce White, ranch manager Bryce LNU, and several chefs.
Epstein's travel pattern involved regular trips to his New York office Monday-Wednesday, with primary residence in the U.S. Virgin Islands and a New Mexico ranch used as a vacation retreat.
